title: How Australia's quantum sector is making big moves in the smallest way | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: Artificial intelligence may have grabbed recent headlines, but a prominent Australian quantum physicist says quantum processing is entering the mainstream and Australia has a big role to play. The founder of Silicon Quantum Computing, Professor Michelle Simmons says she's fielding a lot of interest in the company's just released AI quantum processor, and the long-term goal of building an error-corrected quantum computer remains on track. Professor Simmons spoke to The Business from the sidelines of the UBS Australasia conference. She says the next challenge is bridging the gap of commercialisation.  #ABCBusiness  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Shoppers prepare to spend billions on Black Friday deals | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: It is shaping up to be the biggest retail event of the year with shoppers already hunting for Black Friday deals. Australians are expected to spend a record $6.8 billion over the Black Friday–Cyber Monday weekend, according to research from the Australian Retailers Association (ARA) in partnership with Roy Morgan. That's a 4 per cent increase on last year. Overall, about 6 million Australians are expected to take part in Black Friday sales this year. On average, they will fork out $804 each. Recent interest rate cuts have delivered a greater sense of optimism. Research from Westpac and the Melbourne Institute shows consumer sentiment surged in November by almost 13 per cent. It's the first time that optimists have outnumbered pessimists in years. Other data from Shopify shows more Australians are using artificial intelligence to help guide purchases. Retailers are reaping the rewards, as Australians continue to splash cash, both online and in store.  #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Nauruan president makes secretive parliament visit amid bikie contract claims | ABC NEWS
description: President of Nauru, David Adeang, briefly visited Parliament House in an unannounced visit, where he is understood to have met with the home affairs minister.  The Nauruan president's clandestine visit comes amid accusations criminal bikie gangs were awarded a lucrative contract to provide security for former detainees transferred to Nauru. title: Eight dead and many injured after car explosion near Delhi's historic Red Fort | ABC NEWS
description: Authorities say they are investigating the cause of an explosion in a popular tourist area in the Indian capital of Delhi. Police say the explosion erupted from a car stopped at a red light. At least eight people have been killed and as many as 19 injured, authorities say. title: Plan released to fix 'broken' childcare system | ABC NEWS
description: A group of 55 early childhood academics have urged federal, state and territory governments to take six actions to restore public trust in the childcare system.  These include lifting workforce quality through better pay, conditions and training, lowering staff-to-child ratios and giving regulators better resources to conduct frequent, unannounced inspections. title: Childcare centre and supervisors charged after toddler's death outside Darwin | ABC NEWS
description: A rural Darwin childcare centre, and three of its supervisors, have been charged, after the death of a toddler last year.  22-month-old Ebony Thompson died after becoming trapped on a childcare centre fence, where she was suspended for up to ten minutes. Tilda Colling has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: NSW Nationals reject net zero 'in principle', at odds with state Liberals | ABC NEWS
description: The deepening divide within the federal Coalition over climate policy is exposing fault lines in New South Wales' state parliament. NSW Nationals MPs have given 'in principle' support to their federal cohort's decision to scrap the 2050 net zero emissions target. State Liberal leader Mark Speakman has reaffirmed his support for the target, suggesting the Coalition could lose votes if it were to back down on net zero. title: Remembrance Day services mark 107 years since the end of WWI | ABC NEWS
description: The nation has paused to mark Remembrance Day and honour the more than 100,000 Australians who lost their lives in conflict. It marks 107 years since the end of World War I. The national service at the Australian War Memorial in Canberra looked to the future with a warning against complacency during a time of peace. title: Delhi blast: Indian police invoke anti-terror law, PM Modi alleges conspiracy | The World | ABC News
description: Indian police are investigating a deadly car blast in New Delhi under a law used to fight "terrorism". Prime Minister Narendra Modi has vowed to bring to justice all those responsible. The explosion near the historic Red Fort killed at least eight people and injured 20. It was the first such blast in the heavily guarded city of more than 30 million since 2011. Deputy editor at The Hindu, Vijaita Singh spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about the latest on the investigation. title: United Nations Climate Change Conference COP30 underway in Brazil | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The United Nation's COP30 conference has officially kicked off in the Brazilian city of Belem. Inside the summit, world leaders and indigenous communities will spend the next eleven days working through a climate agenda. Outside, activists are making demands of their own. Amanda Robson reports.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
